factoid: Pierre felt the approach of a fit of nervous depression.
Pierre made desperate efforts to combat the fit of nervous depression.
Pierre's wife had intimacy with Prince Andrew.
Pierre was unexpectedly made a gentleman of the bedchamber.
Pierre began to feel oppressed in court society.
Pierre began to feel ashamed in court society.
Dark thoughts of the vanity of all things human came to Pierre more often than before.
Pierre noticed a feeling between Natásha Rostóva and Prince Andrew.
The feeling between Natásha Rostóva and Prince Andrew accentuated Pierre's gloom.
Pierre tried to avoid thinking about his wife.
Pierre tried to avoid thinking about Natásha Rostóva.
Pierre tried to avoid thinking about Prince Andrew.
Everything seemed insignificant to Pierre compared with eternity.
The question "for what?" presented itself to Pierre.
Pierre forced himself to work day and night at Masonic labors.
Pierre hoped to drive away the evil spirit that threatened him by working at Masonic labors.
Pierre left the countess' apartments before midnight.
Pierre was sitting upstairs in a shabby dressing gown.
Pierre was copying the original transaction of the Scottish lodge of Freemasons.
Pierre's low room was cloudy with tobacco smoke.
Prince Andrew entered Pierre's low room.
Pierre greeted Prince Andrew with "Ah, it’s you!".
Pierre said "I am hard at it" to Prince Andrew.
Pierre pointed to his manuscript book.
Pierre had an air of escaping from the ills of life.
Prince Andrew had a beaming, ecstatic expression of renewed life.
Prince Andrew paused in front of Pierre.
Prince Andrew smiled at Pierre with the egotism of joy.
Prince Andrew told Pierre that he wanted to tell him about it yesterday.
Prince Andrew told Pierre that he has come to tell him today.
Prince Andrew said he never experienced anything like it before.
Prince Andrew said he is in love.
Pierre sighed deeply.
Pierre sat down on the sofa beside Prince Andrew.
Pierre asked if Prince Andrew was with Natásha Rostóva.
Prince Andrew answered "Yes, yes!" to Pierre's question.
Prince Andrew said he should never have believed it.
Prince Andrew said the feeling is stronger than himself.
Prince Andrew said he tormented himself yesterday.
Prince Andrew said he suffered yesterday.
Prince Andrew said he would not exchange that torment for anything in the world.
Prince Andrew said he has not lived until now.
Prince Andrew said at last he lives.
Prince Andrew said he cannot live without Natásha Rostóva.
Prince Andrew asked if Natásha Rostóva loves him.
Prince Andrew said he is too old for Natásha Rostóva.
Prince Andrew asked Pierre why he didn't speak.
Pierre asked what he had told Prince Andrew.
Pierre rose and paced up and down the room.
Pierre said he always thought the girl was a treasure.
Pierre said the girl is a rare girl.
Pierre entreats Prince Andrew not to philosophize.
Pierre entreats Prince Andrew not to doubt.
Pierre entreats Prince Andrew to marry.
Pierre said he is sure there will not be a happier man than Prince Andrew.
Prince Andrew asked what of her.
Prince Andrew said she loves Prince Andrew.
Prince Andrew told Pierre not to talk rubbish.
Pierre said she does love him.
Prince Andrew holds Pierre by the arm.
Prince Andrew told Pierre to listen.
Prince Andrew said he is in a condition.
Prince Andrew said he must talk about it to someone.
Pierre said "Well, go on, go on. I am very glad."
Pierre's face changed.
Pierre's brow became smooth.
Pierre listened gladly to Prince Andrew.
Prince Andrew seemed to Pierre to be a new man.
Prince Andrew really was a new man.
Prince Andrew no longer had spleen, contempt for life, or disillusionment.
Pierre was the only person Prince Andrew spoke openly to.
Prince Andrew told Pierre everything in his soul.
Prince Andrew made plans for an extended future.
Prince Andrew said he could not sacrifice his own happiness to his father's caprice.
Prince Andrew spoke of making his father consent to marriage and love Natásha Rostóva.
Prince Andrew spoke of doing without his father's consent.
Prince Andrew marveled at the feeling that had mastered him.
Prince Andrew said that feeling was strange, apart from, and independent of himself.
Prince Andrew said he should not have believed anyone who told him he was capable of such love.
Prince Andrew said the feeling is not the same as before.
Prince Andrew said the world is divided into two halves.
One half of the world is she, with joy, hope, and light.
The other half of the world is everything where she is not, with gloom and darkness.
Pierre reiterated darkness and gloom.
